description.narrative: Money Trail is a joint project initiated by Free Press Unlimited, Journalismfund.eu, Finance Uncovered and Oxfam Novib in April 2018. Oxfam Novib provides training and grants to civil society activists and coordinates this project. Our mission is to end illicitfinancial flows to ensure more equitable and inclusive societies that boosts citizens# access to health, education and economic opportunity. Developing countries are losing billions of dollars through tax abuse, money laundering and grand corruption. Investigative journalism is key to paving the way for change. It raises awareness amongst citizens and creates a momentum where governments are pressured to act by civil society. Such work has tremendous impact whether it is focusing awareness on illicit finance, helping to recover stolen assets or informing policy. We have already seen this with the Panama papers. However, many stories focus on Europe and the Americas. Money Trail delivers high quality training in financial investigations, digital security and campaign tactics from leading practitioners to more than 200 journalists and civil society activists in Asia, Africa and Europe. Journalismfund.eu providesaround 80 grants to independent financial investigations. Many newly emerging stories about tax abuse and grand corruption will generate citizen awareness and disbelieve. Activists are trained and supported to leverage these stories, using them in their campaign narratives and tactics with a view to change abusive policies and practices. Financial transactions between people and countries have become increasingly complex. Therefore, we need to understand and constantly check realities. We are committed to unravel money trails and tell the truth. Money Trail is supported by the NationalPostcode Lottery (NPL) of the Netherlands.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
